description: Dark chocolate and hazelnut make the perfect pairing. And now, this deliciously inspired combo can be yours in minutes with a few easy steps.
name: Nutty Dark Chocolate Cold Brew
recipeIngredient: 6 oz Starbucks® Dark Chocolate Hazelnut Cold Brew Concentrate
2 oz almondmilk (or your choice of milk)

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 01
recipeInstructions.text: In a large glass, stir together 6 oz of Starbucks® Dark Chocolate Hazelnut Cold Brew Concentrate 6 oz of water, and 1-2 oz Vanilla Syrup.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 02
recipeInstructions.text: Add enough ice to fill the glass to ½ inch below the rim, leaving room for milk.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 03
recipeInstructions.text: Top with your desired amount of almondmilk.

description: Let's mix up one of the greats. Our cold brew concentrate makes it easy to enjoy the café-inspired Vanilla Sweet Cream Cold Brew you know and love from the comfort of home.
name: Vanilla Sweet Cream Cold Brew
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Signature Black Cold Brew Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Place ingredients in a jar that seals tight. Shake well to combine the ingredients.
Measure vanilla syrup into a 16 oz glass.
Add Starbucks® Signature Black Cold Brew Concentrate and water to the glass. Stir to combine.
Fill the glass with ice to a half inch below the rim.
Fill the cup to the rim with vanilla sweet cream.

description: Espresso meets white chocolate in this classic Starbucks® drink. Learn how to make a White Chocolate Mocha at home, then top it off with a dollop of whipped cream for a sweet, creamy beverage that delights with every sip.
name: White Chocolate Mocha​
recipeIngredient: 4 Tbsp white chocolate chips or chopped white chocolate

recipeInstructions.text: Heat up white chocolate chips on low heat until softened.
Prepare 1 shot of espresso and pour into a mug (1 shot = 1 oz).
Stir hot espresso and softened white chocolate together.
Froth 2% milk using your preferred method. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.
Pour frothed milk into mug.
Top with whipped cream.

description: Shake up your coffee routine with a cup of creamy oatmilk, rich espresso and perfectly sweet brown sugar.
name: Iced Brown Sugar Oatmilk Shaken Espresso​
recipeIngredient: 2 shots espresso brewed from Starbucks® Veranda Blend® whole bean ​coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare espresso and pour into a glass.
Stir light brown sugar into the espresso while still hot to dissolve. Refine to your desired level of sweetness.
In a cocktail shaker or mason jar, add espresso, oatmilk and ice and shake for 20 seconds.
Pour into tall glass and top with a dash of cinnamon.

description: Elevate your everyday glass of cold brew with sweet and spiced oatmilk ice and the incredible taste of new Starbucks® Brown Sugar Cinnamon Cold Brew Concentrate.
name: Brown Sugar Cinnamon Cold Brew With Oatmilk Ice
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Brown Sugar Cinnamon Flavored Cold Brew Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Make the oatmilk ice cubes. In a measuring cup with a spout, combine oatmilk, brown sugar and cinnamon. Stir until sugar dissolves.
Pour oatmilk mixture into ice cube trays. Freeze until solid—usually 3–4 hours.
Prepare cold brew by combining concentrate and water. Chill.
Fill glass with oatmilk ice to a half-inch below the rim.
Fill glass with chilled cold brew to a half-inch below the rim.
Top with oatmilk to taste.

description: Enjoy caramel coffee at its creamiest and coldest. This easy café-inspired recipe has everything you love, just in time for summer.
name: Creamy Salted Caramel Cold Brew
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Caramel Dolce Flavored Cold Brew Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Place vanilla syrup into a 16 oz glass.
Add Starbucks® Caramel Dolce Flavored Cold Brew Concentrate and water to the glass. Stir to combine.
Fill the cup with ice to a half inch below the rim.
Using a frother on its cold setting or a frothing wand, froth Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Creamer and pinch of salt.
Fill the glass to the rim with the frothy creamer.

description: Spring gatherings just got more delicious. Grab a bag of Starbucks® Spring Day Blend coffee to craft a crisp, refreshing mocktail at home.
name: Iced Coffee Sparkling Mojito Mocktail
recipeIngredient: 3 sprigs fresh mint (with stems removed and leaves intact)​
4 oz ground Starbucks® Spring Day Blend coffee, brewed and cooled​

recipeInstructions.text: Add sugar, a lime wedge and two sprigs of mint to a tall Collins glass. Muddle.
Add ice to the muddled ingredients. Pour the cooled coffee and top with club soda. Stir gently to combine.
Garnish with a lime wedge and mint sprig to enjoy.

description: Chocolate chip cookies? Even better, Starbucks® Coffee Chocolate Chip Cookies! They’re a classic snack for a reason, and in this recipe we bring the childhood favorite back with a twist to be enjoyed alongside your favorite cup of Starbucks® coffee.
name: Chocolate Chip Cookies Recipe

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Combine butter and vanilla extract in a mixing bowl and cream the mixture until properly aerated.
Add the eggs, one at a time, scraping the sides of the bowl after each egg is added and fully combined.
Sift the dry ingredients together in a separate bowl.
Add dry ingredients to butter and egg mixture and mix until combined.
Add the chocolate chips and mix to incorporate.
Scoop the batter and deposit onto parchment-lined sheet pans.
Bake for 14–16 minutes until center is almost done, rotate halfway.

description: Sea salt, whipped cream and caramel flavors meet in your mug for this delicious drink. With one sip, it’s easy to see why Starbucks® Salted Caramel Mocha is a café favorite. Learn how to make this sweet, salty, delicious drink at home with this recipe.
name: Salted Caramel Mocha​
recipeIngredient: homemade Caramel Sauce (or storebought) for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Add toffee nut syrup and dark chocolate sauce into the mug.
Prepare shot of espresso.
Stir hot espresso into chocolate and toffee nut flavorings.
Froth 2% milk using your preferred method. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.
Pour frothed milk into your mug.
Top with whipped cream, drizzle of caramel sauce and sprinkle of smoked sea salt and sugar topping.

description: Cold brew tonics are making a fizzy splash. They’re like the sophisticated, modern version of the old-fashioned soda fountain drink. But instead of the egg cream’s milk and chocolate syrup, this cold brew tonic recipe features smooth, bold coffee and orange cardamom simple syrup. Learn how to make this recipe using Starbucks® Cold Brew Coffee Multi-Serve Concentrates.
name: Cold Brew Orange Tonic
recipeIngredient: Starbucks® Cold Brew Coffee Multi-Serve Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Pour 4 oz of Starbucks® Multi-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate into a glass over ice, combine with 4 oz of water and stir.
Make the orange cardamom simple syrup by combining water, juice, sugar, cardamom and orange zest in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil to dissolve sugar, then let cool.
Strain out cardamom and orange zest.
Fill a tall glass with ice.
Pour in simple syrup, then add cold brew and tonic water.
Stir and garnish with an orange slice.

description: The Flat White combines steamed milk and rich, dark espresso for a creamy coffee-forward drink that’s worth savoring. If you’re feeling creative, the Flat White is also the introductory drink used for baristas who are learning to make latte art, so feel free to use this coffee as a delicious canvas.
name: Flat White

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare 2 shots of espresso and pour into a mug.
Froth whole milk using your preferred method. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.

Gently pour your frothed milk into your mug until it’s almost full, then focus on the middle of your mug and pour a little faster so the foam will come out without moving your pitcher. As the foam starts to come out, continue to pour until you get a dot in the middle.
Feel free to try your hand at latte art.

description: This Starbucks classic combines espresso, bittersweet mocha sauce and steamed milk for a sweetly satisfying coffee. Top it off with whipped cream and chocolate shavings for a delicious mug of coffee ready to be enjoyed any time at home.
name: Caffè Mocha
recipeIngredient: 1 oz  Starbucks® Espresso Roast ground coffee or

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare 1 shot of espresso and pour into a mug.
Froth your milk using your preferred method. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.
Add mocha sauce into your mug and gently stir into the coffee.
Gently pour your frothed milk into your mug until it’s almost full.

description: Chocolate syrup, cinnamon syrup and creamy oatmilk cold foam come together with Starbucks® Cinnamon Dolce Naturally Flavored Coffee for a drink that’s equal parts rich and refreshing. Take a moment for yourself and chill out with an Iced Cinnamon Dolce Mocha with Cinnamon Oatmilk Cold Foam. ​
name: Iced Cinnamon Dolce Mocha With Cinnamon Oatmilk Cold Foam
recipeIngredient: 8 oz Starbucks® Cinnamon Dolce Naturally Flavored Coffee, brewed and cooled
2 Tbsp homemade Cinnamon Dolce Syrup (or storebought)
Ground cinnamon, cinnamon stick, cocoa, or chocolate shavings for garnish (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Pour chocolate syrup into a 16-oz glass.​
Add cooled Starbucks® Cinnamon Dolce to the glass. Stir.​
Fill the cup with ice to ½ inch below the rim.​

Froth oatmilk and cinnamon syrup using your preferred cold method. You can use a handheld frother or froth the oatmilk by hand. For more information on how to froth milk or milk alternatives, see our frothing guide here.
Fill the glass to the rim with the cinnamon oatmilk cold foam.
Garnish with a sprinkle of cocoa or ground cinnamon, a cinnamon stick or chocolate shavings.

description: The perfect sweetness of caramel meets with the taste of juicy apple in a new fall favorite. The hearty spices in Starbucks® Fall Blend adds depth and richness to a cup that’s made for crisp fall mornings. Enjoy our Salted Caramel Apple Crafted Coffee all season long.
name: Salted Caramel Apple Crafted Coffee​
recipeIngredient: 6 oz brewed Starbucks® Fall Blend K-Cup® Pods (or ground coffee)
Dash of ground cinnamon for garnish
Rolled vanilla wafer cookie for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Stir together loosely packed brown sugar and water in a saucepan. Bring to a simmer over low heat.
Once sugar is dissolved, add cinnamon, ground cloves, salt and apple sauce. Let simmer for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat. Strain through fine mesh strainer into a bowl until all liquid has dripped through. Gently stirring can help the liquid pass through the strainer.
Stir in caramel sauce while the sugar mixture is still warm.
Store in a covered container in the refrigerator for up to 7 days.
Add Salted Caramel Apple Syrup to a 12-oz mug.
Brew 6 oz of Starbucks® Fall Blend directly into the mug. Stir.
Froth 4 oz whole milk using your desired method for warm frothing. Once frothed, add to the mug.
Top with any (or all) of the following: whipped cream, a drizzle of caramel, a dusting of cinnamon or a rolled vanilla wafer cookie for stirring.

description: This caramel-infused Iced Latte is topped with a drizzle of rich vanilla cream and is as simple to make as it is delicious. Here’s how to balance the flavors perfectly for a sweet way to cool off with a refreshing caramel coffee.
name: Iced Caramel Latte with Vanilla Cream
recipeIngredient: 2 oz espresso or coffee from a stovetop brewer (try Starbucks® Espresso Roast)

recipeInstructions.text: Add heavy whipping cream, vanilla and granulated sugar to a medium-sized bowl.
Using a hand mixer or whisk, beat until it achieves a thick and creamy consistency. Be careful not to overmix, or you’ll end up with whipped cream.
Add caramel sauce, brown sugar and brewed espresso to a large glass.
Mix together until combined, then add ice.
Slowly top off with the vanilla cream.

description: Wake up to an intoxicating swirl of vanilla, turmeric, ginger, cinnamon and pepper.  Our Golden Turmeric Latte recipe is a delicious new twist on your favorite Starbucks® drink. Spice up your morning routine, and treat yourself to a swirl of spices right in your cup.
name: Golden Turmeric Latte
recipeIngredient: 1  Starbucks® by Nespresso® Blonde Espresso Roast capsule

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the oatmilk in the Aeroccino frother and froth on medium setting.
Combine espresso shot, vanilla, turmeric, ground ginger, cinnamon and dash of black pepper with milk and gently stir.
Sweeten with honey to taste.
Top it off with a dollop of foam.
Optional: Sprinkle ground cinnamon on top.

description: Starbucks® Premium Instant, our new instant coffee, is made with 100% arabica beans. That means you can enjoy the delicious Starbucks® coffee taste you love in an instant. In addition to the convenience of having Starbucks® coffee ready at a moment’s notice, Starbucks® Premium Instant Coffee is a versatile coffee that can be enjoyed many different ways. Try our Iced Premium Instant Coffee recipe—a delicious way to stir up a refreshing beverage in an instant.
name: Iced Premium Instant Coffee
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp Starbucks® Premium Instant Medium Roast

recipeInstructions.text: Scoop instant coffee into your favorite mug.
Add cool or room temperature water.
Grab a spoon and stir until the microgrounds have dissolved.
Add ice.

description: You know it and love it. Craft your own creamy and delicious caffè latte at home, featuring Starbucks® Espresso Roast.
name: Caffè Latte
recipeIngredient: Optional sweetener of choice such as homemade Vanilla Syrup (or storebought)

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare espresso shot and pour into mug once brewed.
Stir in optional sweetener.
In a separate container, steam and froth milk until you have a light layer of foam.
Gently pour the steamed milk into the brewed coffee while holding back the milk foam from glass.
Top with the thin layer of milk foam remaining in the container. Enjoy. ​

description: The Starbucks® Blonde Vanilla Latte: where fluffy frothed milk and delicious vanilla syrup come together over a shot of espresso for a drink that’s smooth, delicious and invigorating. Learn how to make a delicious café-style vanilla latte at home with only three ingredients.
name: Starbucks® Blonde Vanilla Latte
recipeIngredient: 1  Starbucks® Blonde Espresso Roast by Nespresso® capsule

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare 1 shot of Starbucks® Blonde Espresso Roast by Nespresso® and pour into a mug.
Froth milk. If using the Nespresso® Aeroccino, froth milk on the medium froth setting.
Add vanilla syrup to your mug of espresso and gently stir in.
Gently pour your frothed milk into your mug until it’s almost full.
Spoon any remaining foam onto the top of your beverage.

description: Add some fun flair and great flavor to your glass of iced coffee with caramel stripes in this easy-to-make recipe.
name: Brown Sugar Cinnamon Iced Coffee With Caramel Stripes
recipeIngredient: 8 oz brewed Starbucks® Brown Sugar Cinnamon Naturally Flavored Coffee or 1 K-Cup® Pod

recipeInstructions.text: Brew Starbucks® Brown Sugar Cinnamon Flavored Coffee at double strength.  Place brewed coffee and a glass in the refrigerator to chill.
Pour caramel sauce into chilled glass. ​
Make the caramel stripes.
Fill the glass with ice to a half-inch below the rim.​
Add chilled coffee and top with Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Creamer. Stir gently. ​

description: Drizzle all the way! Embrace the season with this deliciously fun caramel spiced iced coffee featuring Starbucks® Gingerbread Naturally Flavored Coffee and Caramel Flavored Creamer.
name: Iced Gingerbread Caramel Coffee
recipeIngredient: 6 oz double-strength Starbucks® Gingerbread Naturally Flavored Coffee, (double strength with 4 Tbsp)​

recipeInstructions.text: Place ice into 16-oz glass.
Brew Starbucks® Gingerbread Naturally Flavored Coffee at double strength and pour into glass.
Add Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Creamer​. Stir.
Top with whipped cream, a drizzle of Caramel Sauce and a pinch of nutmeg. Enjoy!

description: Caffè Americano is an Italian interpretation of “American coffee” that swaps out milk with hot water for a simple espresso drink that has become a staple at our cafés. Learn how to make the Starbucks® classic at home, all it takes is two ingredients and a steady pour.
name: Caffè Americano

recipeInstructions.text: Bring water to a boil and pour into your mug.
Prepare 2 shots of espresso.
Slowly pour your 2 shots of espresso into the water.

description: Enjoy this chilled version of the café favorite Pumpkin Spice Latte. Simply combine an easy-to-make glass of cold brew with homemade syrup and a delicious pumpkin spice whipped cream for the perfect blend of fall flavors.
name: Pumpkin Whipped Cream Cold Brew​
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Cold Brew Signature Black Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Combine sugar and water in saucepan and bring to a simmer.
Once sugar is dissolved, add cinnamon sticks, ground cloves, ginger, nutmeg and pumpkin purée, and let simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove from heat and immediately strain through cheesecloth.
Get a jump-start on the whipped cream by placing a whisk and large mixing bowl in freezer to chill, at least 15 minutes.
Pour Starbucks® Cold Brew Signature Black Concentrate into a glass over ice, add water and stir.
Stir Vanilla Syrup into cold brew.

In chilled mixing bowl, vigorously whisk heavy whipping cream, sugar and Homemade Pumpkin Spice Syrup to desired thickness (2 to 5 minutes). Layer Pumpkin Whipped Cream over the top of cold brew to taste.
Personalize with a sprinkle of ground nutmeg!

description: The Mocha Frozen Blended Coffee, where coffee, milk, ice and chocolaty goodness all come together for a delicious cold drink. Inspired by the café favorite Starbucks® Frappuccino® Blended Beverage, this recipe is perfect whenever you're in need of a sweet pick-me-up. Top it off with whipped cream and chocolate shavings for a sweet ending that’s deliciously Starbucks.
name: Mocha Frozen Blended Coffee​

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare 1 shot of espresso.
Place ice, milk, chocolate sauce and espresso into a blender. Start at low speed, then blend on high for 30 seconds.
Pour blended mixture into 16-oz glass.
Top with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.

description: Cold brew has become the go-to drink when you need a quick pick-me-up, and it’s easy to see why. Equal parts refreshing, energizing and customizable, cold brew is a drink that can satisfy any coffee fan with ease. With Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrates, available in both single-serve and multi-serve formats, it’s easier than ever to enjoy the cold brew taste you love at home. We’ll show you three different ways to dress up your cold brew so your cup is always exciting and always delicious.
name: Cold Brew 3 Ways

recipeInstructions.name: WHAT YOU’LL NEED
recipeInstructions.text: 8 oz Starbucks® Multi-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate or 1 pod Starbucks® Single-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate4 oz sparkling water4 oz homemade lemonade (recipe below) or store-bought lemonadeLemon slice, for garnish

recipeInstructions.name: FOR LEMONADE
recipeInstructions.text: ¼ cup white sugar2 cups still water, separated2 oz fresh-squeezed lemon juice

Begin by making homemade lemonade. In a small pot, combine sugar and ¼ cup of water. Stir over medium heat until sugar has dissolved into simple syrup. After 5 minutes remove from heat and let cool completely.
In a pitcher or large jar, add remaining water, the simple syrup and lemon juice. Stir to combine. Store lemonade in an airtight container, refrigerated for up to 7 days.

For each serving, pour 8 oz of Starbucks® Multi-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate into a glass over ice, combine with 4 oz of sparkling water and stir. If using Starbucks® Single-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate, pour 1 pod into a glass over ice, combine with 8 oz of water and stir.
Pour 4 oz of lemonade in the glass of cold brew. Garnish with a lemon slice.

recipeInstructions.name: HOW TO MAKE
recipeInstructions.text: Grapefruit Basil Cold Brew

recipeInstructions.name: WHAT YOU’LL NEED
recipeInstructions.text: ½ Tbsp Grapefruit Basil Simple Syrup (recipe below)2 oz Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrate2 oz tonic waterIce

recipeInstructions.name: FOR GRAPEFRUIT BASIL SYRUP
recipeInstructions.text: 1 oz water1 oz grapefruit juice¼ cup sugar¼ cup fresh basil leavesZest of 1 small grapefruitGrapefruit slices, for garnishFresh basil, for garnish
Begin by combining all grapefruit basil syrup ingredients in a small saucepan. Slowly bring to a boil, stirring until sugar has dissolved.
Strain the syrup into an airtight container. If making ahead, you can keep the syrup refrigerated for up to 1 month.
Combine Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrate, 1 Tbsp Grapefruit Basil Simple Syrup and tonic water over ice and stir.
Garnish with a slice of grapefruit and basil!

recipeInstructions.name: HOW TO MAKE
recipeInstructions.text: Cherry Cold Brew

recipeInstructions.name: WHAT YOU’LL NEED
recipeInstructions.text: 4 oz Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrate2 Tbsp maraschino cherry juiceIce4 oz tonic waterMaraschino cherries, for garnish
Stir together Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrate, maraschino cherry juice and ice.
Top with tonic water and garnish with a maraschino cherry.

description: Our Iced Latte recipe turns your favorite morning beverage into a refreshing drink that you can enjoy at any time of the day. All you need is some ice, a splash of milk and rich espresso-like coffee from a stovetop brewer. Grab your mason jar to add some cold foam for an elevated twist, or customize your coffee with a little vanilla for a classic Iced Vanilla Latte.
name: Iced Latte
recipeIngredient: Optional sweetener of choice, such as homemade Vanilla Syrup (or storebought)

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a tall glass with ice, and pour in the freshly brewed espresso.
Pour the milk and optional sweetener into a mason jar until it’s ¾ full.
Seal the jar tightly, and shake, shake, shake.
Pour the milk and foam into the glass with the ice and espresso.

description: Bring your favorite fall coffee home! Follow this simple recipe to create a cozy, homemade Pumpkin Spice Latte from scratch.
name: Pumpkin Spice Latte

recipeInstructions.text: Combine sugar and water in saucepan and bring to a simmer.
Once sugar is dissolved, add cinnamon sticks, ground cloves, ginger, nutmeg and pumpkin purée, and let simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove from heat and immediately strain through cheesecloth.
Heat and froth milk in a Nespresso® Aeroccino frother. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.
Brew Starbucks® Espresso Roast in an espresso machine or stovetop moka pot, or brew a Starbucks® by Nespresso® Espresso Roast capsule in a Nespresso® machine.
Place Homemade Pumpkin Spice Syrup into a mug, followed by hot espresso. Stir together.
Fill mug with heated frothed milk until ¾ full, then top with whipped cream.
Sprinkle with pumpkin pie spice!

description: There’s a reason we use caramel sauce in so many of our recipes: It’s rich, creamy and brings a special sweetness to a cup of coffee. Follow this simple recipe and enjoy the taste of caramel in your favorite Starbucks® coffee.
name: Caramel Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Mix and stir all ingredients in a small saucepan. Heat on medium-low for 1 minute.
Reduce heat to a low and simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat. Once cooled, enjoy in your favorite Starbucks® coffee or recipe.

description: Add the exciting sweetness of caramel syrup to any coffee at home with this delicious recipe.
name: Caramel Syrup

recipeInstructions.text: Combine sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium heat until it dissolves, about 3 to 4 minutes. Do not let it boil.
Once completely dissolved, increase heat to medium-high and cover. Let boil for 2 to 3 minutes.
Uncover and stir slowly until the color resembles light honey, about 6 minutes.
Remove from heat. Very carefully add hot water. The mixture may spurt when adding water, so stand back.
Once the bubbling slows, add vanilla and stir slowly to combine.
Let cool completely before using. Store syrup in an airtight container for up to two weeks.

description: Perk up your senses with this rich and refreshing iced coffee drink. Our Iced Hazelnut Coffee recipe is easy to make. Try it with Pike Place® Roast or any of your favorite Starbucks® coffees, then mix and top with milk for a delicious and cool drink that offers a sweet take on iced coffee.
name: Iced Hazelnut Coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Add ice and Hazelnut Syrup to a tall glass.
Brew Pike Place® Roast, then add to glass.
Top with milk.
Stir until Hazelnut Syrup is combined.

description: Condensed milk is a popular ingredient in coffee drinks around the world, from the sweet, creamy Vietnamese iced coffee (cà phê sữa dá) to Spain’s rich coffee drink (café bombón), where a layer of condensed milk is poured beneath a fresh pull of espresso. This cinnamon-infused version of the café favorite is simple to make—just shake it up and pour for a refreshing iced coffee that’s equal parts spicy and sweet.
name: Iced Cinnamon Coffee
recipeIngredient: 5 oz  double-strength coffee (try Starbucks® Breakfast Blend)

recipeInstructions.text: Stir coffee, condensed milk and ground cinnamon together in a cocktail shaker.
Add ice.
Cover and shake vigorously for 2 minutes.
Strain into a glass filled with ice.

description: In this festive recipe, brown sugar, molasses and cinnamon come together to highlight the delicious spiced notes of our Starbucks® Gingerbread Flavored Coffee.
name: Sweet & Spiced Gingerbread Coffee
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp brown sugar, plus a sprinkle for garnish
0.125 tsp cinnamon, plus a sprinkle for garnish
8 fl oz Starbucks® Gingerbread Flavored Coffee K-Cup® pod, brewed

recipeInstructions.text: Place molasses, brown sugar and cinnamon into a mug.
Stir in brewed coffee.
Froth milk and pour over the coffee.
Top with a sprinkle of cinnamon and brown sugar.

description: Coconutmilk and espresso are paired over a bed of ice in this cold, classic coffee drink that’s sweet, refreshing and delicious. Enjoy this delectable dairy-free latte anytime you’re in the mood for a fruit-flavored pick-me-up.
name: Iced Coconutmilk Latte
recipeIngredient: 1  Starbucks® by Nespresso® Espresso Roast capsule or

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare 1 shot of espresso. Let cool.
Pour your coconutmilk and your espresso shot over ice and stir.

description: Enjoy the rich, nutty sophistication of hazelnut syrup in your coffee with this simple recipe.
name: Hazelnut Syrup

recipeInstructions.text: Stirring occasionally, toast hazelnuts in a pan on medium heat for about 4 minutes or until aromatic.
Combine all ingredients in a small saucepan over medium-high heat.
Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer until thickened, about 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and let hazelnuts steep in syrup for at least 1 hour.
Strain the cooled syrup through a fine mesh sieve to remove the hazelnuts.
Store syrup in an airtight container for up to two weeks.

description: When life gives you a lemon twist, add a vanilla coffee spritz. Try this citrusy and bubbly drink with Starbucks® Spring Day Blend coffee to brighten your spring coffee routine.
name: Vanilla Coffee Spritzer with a Lemon Twist
recipeIngredient: 3 oz Coffee Vanilla Simple Syrup (recipe below)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine sugar and brewed Starbucks® Spring Day Blend coffee in a heatproof bowl. Stir.​
Once sugar is dissolved, allow to cool and add vanilla extract.
Store in a container in refrigerator until ready to use.
Slice and juice the lemon.
Fill a tall Collins glass with crushed ice, Coffee Vanilla Syrup and lemon juice. Top with soda water and stir to combine. Garnish with lemon zest and enjoy.​

description: Rich vanilla-flavored coffee, creamy oatmilk, sweet vanilla syrup and nothing else. The beauty of this recipe for Nespresso® Original Line lies in its simplicity. Make yours and craft a moment of calm in your day.
name: Double-Vanilla Oatmilk Café Au Lait
recipeIngredient: 2  brewed espresso shots of Starbucks® Vanilla Flavored Coffee by Nespresso®

recipeInstructions.text: Pour vanilla syrup into a 12-oz mug.
Brew 2 shots of Starbucks® Vanilla Flavored Coffee by Nespresso® into the mug.
Froth oatmilk using a Nespresso® Aeroccino on the heated setting or a handheld frother. If using a frother, warm milk before frothing.
Gently pour frothed milk into mug until almost full. Spoon any remaining foam on top.

description: Brighten your brew with lemonade and a splash of sparkling water. It may seem an unlikely combination, but adding lemonade to your homemade iced coffee creates a bold, tangy and delicious drink. Think of it as an Arnold Palmer, with strong coffee instead of black tea.
name: Iced Coffee Lemonade
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup lemonade (either ready-made or use our recipe below)

recipeInstructions.text: In a small saucepan, combine sugar and water. Stir over medium heat for 5 minutes until sugar has dissolved into a simple syrup.
Remove from heat and let cool completely.
Juice lemons.
Stir together remaining water, simple syrup and lemon juice.
Fill a glass with ice.
Prepare double-strength coffee in your preferred method. For optimal taste, we recommend using the coffee press method.
Mix together lemonade and coffee, leaving room to customize to taste. We recommend 1 part coffee to 1 part lemonade.
Add a splash of sparkling water.

description: Just in time for your spring happy hours. Craft a cocktail that will wow with the sweet and nutty flavor of Starbucks® Toasted Coconut Mocha Flavored Coffee and richness of Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Creamer.
name: Coconut Caramel Cream Cocktail​
recipeIngredient: 3 oz Starbucks® Toasted Coconut Mocha Flavored Coffee, brewed and cooled
0.5 tsp homemade Caramel Sauce (or storebought), plus more to taste
homemade Caramel Sauce (or storebought) for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Brew your coffee and allow to cool.
Place ice into a blender, then add cooled Starbucks® Toasted Coconut Mocha Flavored Coffee, rum, almond liqueur, Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Creamer, Caramel Sauce and cinnamon. Blend until smooth.​
Drizzle a line of Caramel Sauce along the inside of your glass.
Pour blended cocktail into glass and enjoy.

description: Ready to shake things up? Craft rich notes of caramelized vanilla in this café-inspired shaken iced coffee recipe featuring Starbucks® Vanilla Flavored Coffee.​
name: Iced Toasted Vanilla Shaken Coffee with Oatmilk
recipeIngredient: 6 oz Starbucks® Vanilla Flavored Coffee (K-Cup® pod or ground coffee)

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the vanilla bean.
Caramelize sugar in skillet with vanilla. Then remove from heat and cool for up to 5 minutes.​
Add water to the cooled skilled. Turn heat back on and gently boil until caramelized sugar dissolves and combines with the water.
Store in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
Prepare 6 oz of Starbucks® Vanilla Flavored Coffee and pour into a cocktail shaker or Mason jar.
Stir 2 oz of Toasted Vanilla Syrup into the coffee and add ½ cup of ice. Shake for 20 seconds.
Strain into a tall glass with fresh ice. Add oatmilk and enjoy.

description: The richness of cookie butter and cinnamon spice. The humble goodness of oatmilk. The delicious smoothness of Starbucks® Veranda Blend® coffee. The Oatmeal Cookie Café Au Lait is wholesome, familiar and truly scrumptious.​
name: Oatmeal Cookie Café Au Lait
recipeIngredient: 8 oz brewed Starbucks® Veranda Blend® or Starbucks® Veranda Blend® K-Cup Pod
4 oz oatmilk, traditional milk or your favorite milk alternative
1 Tbsp cookie butter to melt for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Add 8 oz Starbucks® Veranda Blend® coffee to a 12-oz mug.
Heat oatmilk, traditional milk or your preferred alternative with cookie butter, sugar and cinnamon. Froth.
Add cookie butter mixture to mug.
Top with whipped cream and a drizzle of melted cookie butter.

description: Learn how to make a Honey Almondmilk Flat White, a delicious and dairy-free take on the classic café beverage where each sip offers just a hint of delectable honey.
name: Honey Almondmilk Flat White​

recipeInstructions.text: First, make the honey syrup. Combine 1 cup of honey and 1 cup of water in a small pot on the stove over medium heat until lightly simmering.
Let simmer for 5–7 minutes while stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and let cool for 20–30 minutes. You can store your honey syrup in the fridge for up to 7 days.
Prepare 2 shots of espresso and pour into a mug.
Add 1 oz of honey syrup to the mug and stir.

Froth almondmilk using your preferred method. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here. As you froth your milk, try using a spoon to gently push the microbubbles to the bottom of the pitcher. This will result in a smoother, more velvety texture for your flat white.

Gently pour your frothed milk into your mug until it’s almost full, then focus on the middle of your mug and pour a little faster so the foam will come out without moving your pitcher. As the foam starts to come out, continue to pour until you get a dot in the middle.

description: In this refreshing twist on cold brew, the sweetness of homemade honey syrup combines with a pinch of savory salt for a uniquely delicious coffee that still feels distinctly Starbucks.
name: Cold Brew With Salted Honey Foam
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup skim milk (or milk of choice)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine honey and water in a small pot on the stove over medium heat until lightly simmering.
Let simmer for 5–7 minutes while stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat, and let cool for 20–30 minutes.
Add skim milk, Honey Syrup and a pinch of salt to a milk frother.
Using the frother’s cold froth setting, froth the mixture for 2 minutes until thick and creamy.
Pour 4 oz of Starbucks® Multi-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate into a glass over ice, combine with 4 oz of water and stir.
Stir in the remaining Honey Syrup.
Pour or spoon the salted cream cold foam over top!

description: Grab your Starbucks VIA® Instant and whip up a delicious Dalgona that’s as customizable as it is photogenic. Hailing from Korea and popular online, this coffee is easy and fun to make.
name: Starbucks® Dalgona Whipped Coffee
recipeIngredient: 1 packets Starbucks VIA® Instant Pike Place® Roast

recipeInstructions.text: In a mixing bowl, combine your Starbucks VIA® Instant coffee, sugar and water.
Whisk together vigorously until the mixture turns light and fluffy.
Continue whisking until your mixture thickens and holds a foamy texture.
Fill your glass most of the way up with ice and the milk of your choice.
Dollop and swirl the whipped coffee mixture on top.

description: Lemon bars are a perfectly powdery and tastefully tart way to sweeten up someone’s day. Whether it’s a special occasion, a treat alongside breakfast or a lemony accompaniment to your favorite cup of Starbucks® coffee, this recipe is guaranteed to be a delectable crowd-pleaser.
name: Lemon Bars Recipe

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix all crust ingredients together into a coarse meal.
Line bottom quarter of your sheet-pan with mix. Pack firmly by pressing with hands.
Bake to dry out for 15 minutes. Let cool before adding lemon batter.
Mix all filling ingredients together.
Pour lemon batter over cool lemon bar crust.
Bake in oven for 20 minutes or until set to the touch.
Let the bars cool and then chill in the refrigerator.
Once cold, remove from baking pan, then cut into bars, about 1½ by 2½ inches.
Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

description: Debuted by Starbucks in 1996, the Caramel Macchiato has been a café favorite for over two decades. Learn how to craft this coffee classic at home with this simple recipe. Make it frothy with a mix of smooth vanilla and velvety caramel for the perfect amount of sweetness. Top it off with a drizzle of caramel for a coffee that tastes as delicious as it looks.
name: Caramel Macchiato
recipeIngredient: 1  Starbucks® Espresso Roast by Nespresso® capsule​
homemade Caramel Sauce (or storebought) for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Pour vanilla syrup into the bottom of your mug.
In a separate container, froth the milk and then pour into mug.
Prepare 1 shot of Starbucks® Espresso Roast by Nespresso® and pour through the foam.
Drizzle caramel sauce on top. Enjoy!

description: Turn any day into a special occasion. This Vanilla Iced Coffee with Cake Batter Foam packs all the delicious nostalgia of your favorite cake into each easy glass.
name: Vanilla Iced Coffee With Cake Batter Foam
recipeIngredient: 6 oz  Starbucks® Iced Coffee Blend coffee, brewed according to instructions
0.25 tsp cake batter flavored extract (or ½ tsp butter flavored extract and ½ tsp almond extract)*​

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 01
recipeInstructions.text: Fill a 16-oz tumbler (glass not recommended) with ice, about ¾ of the way.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 02
recipeInstructions.text: Brew Starbucks® Vanilla Iced Coffee Blend K-Cup® Pod (as directed) into the tumbler using the 6-oz iced setting on the brewer. Use the strong or iced button if available. Or, if using Starbucks® Iced Coffee Blend Ground Coffee, brew 3 Tbsp coffee grounds per 6 oz of water in your brewer of choice. Pour coffee into the tumbler.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 03
recipeInstructions.text: Using any cold frothing method, froth together Starbucks® Vanilla Flavored Creamer, milk and desired flavored extracts.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 04
recipeInstructions.text: Add as much or as little foam as you desire to the top of your drink.​

description: Sweet. Creamy. And chilled to perfection. Rich espresso, milk and vanilla syrup are topped with caramel for a delightfully refreshing start to your day.
name: Iced Caramel Macchiato
recipeIngredient: homemade Caramel Sauce (or storebought) for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Place vanilla syrup in a glass.
Add cold 2% milk.
Fill glass with ice to ½ inch below rim.
Pour in Starbucks® espresso shots.
Top with caramel sauce.

description: Warm days are made for cold foam. Start your morning with an icy sweet treat.
name: Vanilla Sweet Cream Cold Foam

recipeInstructions.text: Brew Starbucks® Breakfast Blend at double strength and pour over ice.
Combine milk, powdered sugar and vanilla extract​ in separate pourable container.
Froth milk mixture using your preferred cold method. You can use a handheld milk frother or froth your milk by hand. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.
Top iced coffee with cold foam.

description: A beloved café favorite, the Caffè Misto is easy to make and adore. Simply combine the well-balanced taste of Starbucks® Caffè Verona®, luscious crema brewed by Nespresso® Vertuo, and frothed milk to create this delightful cup.
name: Caffè Misto
recipeIngredient: 1  brewed coffee capsule of Starbucks® Caffè Verona® for Nespresso® Vertuo
4 oz 2% milk (or any creamy non-dairy alternative)​

recipeInstructions.text: Brew 1 capsule of Starbucks® Caffè Verona® for Nespresso® Vertuo into a 16-oz mug.
Froth milk using a Nespresso® Aeroccino on the heated setting or a handheld frother. ​
Add frothed milk to the mug.​

description: Soft and balanced shots of Starbucks® Blonde Espresso Roast by Nespresso®. Shaken over ice with vanilla syrup. Topped with maple cold foam and a pinch of spice. A Vanilla-Maple Shaken Espresso is layered with incredible flavor.
name: Vanilla-Maple Shaken Espresso
recipeIngredient: 3 shots Starbucks® Blonde Espresso Roast by Nespresso®
Pinch of pumpkin pie spice (or cinnamon and nutmeg)

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 01
recipeInstructions.text: Brew espresso shots.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 02
recipeInstructions.text: Fill a tall glass 3/4 full of ice.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 03
recipeInstructions.text: Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add espresso shots and vanilla syrup.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 04
recipeInstructions.text: Shake vigorously until the exterior of the cocktail shaker is cold. Strain into glass.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 05
recipeInstructions.text: Froth oatmilk and maple syrup until desired texture is reached.

recipeInstructions.name: STEP 06
recipeInstructions.text: Top shaken espresso with maple cold foam and a pinch of pumpkin pie spice.

description: Add a springtime spin to your coffee routine with a delicious layering of blueberry flavor and an iced cup of Starbucks® Spring Day Blend.
name: Blueberry Swirl Iced Coffee
recipeIngredient: 8 oz Starbucks® Spring Day Blend, brewed and cooled

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the blueberries, honey and vanilla in a small saucepan.​
Heat over medium-high heat for 3–4 minutes, until blueberries have broken down. Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
Blend blueberry mixture in a high-speed or immersion blender until smooth.​
Brew your coffee and allow it to cool. ​
Pour the blueberry compote in a 16 oz glass, sprinkle with desired amount of sugar and top with ice.​
Froth milk to create cold foam using an aerator or handheld frother. ​
Gently pour the cold foam into glass on top of the blueberry compote. ​
Fill your glass with cooled Starbucks® Spring Day Blend​. Enjoy. ​

description: When you'd like to sweeten a coffee beverage without changing its flavor, make simple syrup your go-to.
name: Simple Syrup

recipeInstructions.text: Combine sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium-high heat.
Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer until thickened,  about 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and let cool completely.
Store syrup in an airtight container for up to two weeks.

description: Time to cozy up by the fire. Celebrate the season with this delicious peppermint and white chocolaty recipe featuring new Starbucks® Holiday Blend for Nespresso® Vertuo and Starbucks® White Chocolate Flavored Creamer.
name: Peppermint White Chocolate Coffee
recipeIngredient: 1  brewed coffee capsule of Starbucks® Holiday Blend for Nespresso® Vertuo
1 oz Starbucks® White Chocolate Flavored Creamer
1  peppermint puff candy (or other desired peppermint candy)​
Whipped cream as garnish, if desired

recipeInstructions.text: Place the peppermint candy into a 12-oz mug and then brew 1 capsule of Starbucks® Holiday Blend for Nespresso® Vertuo on top.
Froth milk and Starbucks® White Chocolate Flavored Creamer together using a Nespresso® Aeroccino on the heated setting or with a handheld frother. ​
Add frothed mixture into your mug of coffee. If desired, top with whipped cream. Enjoy.

description: A recipe for the true pumpkin spice aficionados out there. A mug of Starbucks® Pumpkin Spice Naturally Flavored Coffee and Creamer are topped off with whipped cream and a dusting of pumpkin pie spice. To all our pumpkin spice fans out there, this one’s for you.
name: Triple Pumpkin Spice Coffee
recipeIngredient: 1  Starbucks® Pumpkin Spice Naturally Flavored Coffee K-Cup® Pod
2 Tbsp Starbucks® Pumpkin Spice Flavored Creamer
2 pinches of homemade pumpkin pie spice (or store bought)

recipeInstructions.text: Place all ingredients in a small jar that seals tight.
Shake to combine.
Add Starbucks® Pumpkin Spice Flavored Creamer and sugar into an empty mug.
Brew 8 oz of Starbucks® Pumpkin Spice Naturally Flavored Coffee K-Cup® Pod directly into mug.
Stir and top with whipped cream.
Sprinkle pumpkin pie spice on top of whipped cream.

description: Espresso, shaken, not stirred. Grab your fanciest martini glass and get shaking on our Espresso Martini recipe, a delicious way to enjoy your favorite espresso flavor and unwind with a rich cocktail at the same time.
name: Espresso Martini

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare 1 shot of Starbucks® Espresso Roast coffee and let cool before prepping the cocktail.
Place the vodka, coffee liqueur and espresso in a cocktail shaker with ice.​
Shake vigorously 10 times, then strain briskly into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with 3 coffee beans and serve immediately.​

description: Our Coffee Cake has been a classic in our cafés for almost as long as they’ve been open. Bring the quintessential sweet treat home in all its cinnamon swirly goodness with this recipe. Enjoy alongside a cup of rich and lively Breakfast Blend coffee for a delicious combination of sweet morning flavors.
name: Cinnamon Coffee Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F.
In a large bowl, mix together room temperature butter and sugar. It should be light and fluffy; do not over whip.
Stop and scrape down the sides and bottom of bowl.
Now add in 1 egg at a time, mixing in between each addition. Stop and scrape down the sides and bottom of bowl.
Combine the vanilla extract and Greek yogurt.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
Add ⅓ of the flour mixture to the egg mixture, followed by ⅓ of the yogurt mixture. Repeat 2 more times until all the ingredients are incorporated.
Combine all cinnamon streusel ingredients with a fork until they reach a crumbly consistency, do not over mix into paste.

Fill ⅓ of a greased muffin tin or mini loaf pan with batter, sprinkle thin layer of cinnamon streusel mixture on top of batter, then repeat process one more time so that muffin tin or loaf pan is ⅔ filled with streusel on top.
Bake for 12–15 minutes, let cool, then serve and enjoy alongside a freshly brewed cup of Starbucks® Breakfast Blend coffee.

description: Spice up your daily cup. A bit of cinnamon and nutmeg (and a pinch of cayenne) give your coffee some bite. Cocoa and sugar add a note of sultry sweetness. And warm milk smoothes it all out for a perfectly flavorful cup.
name: Mexican Coffee Recipe
recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp brown sugar or powdered sugar
6 oz brewed coffee (try Starbucks® House Blend)
0.333 cup whole milk or half and half

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the sugar, cocoa powder, cinnamon, nutmeg and ground cayenne together in a large mug.
Pour in the coffee.
Pour in the warm milk or half and half.
Top with a dollop of whipped cream, if desired.

description: Sweet and salty goodness. Mix up your coffee routine with the café-inspired Pistachio Latte featuring Starbucks® Espresso Roast.
name: Pistachio Latte
recipeIngredient: 1 oz espresso shot of Starbucks® Espresso Roast

recipeInstructions.text: Combine sugar and water in a small pot. Bring to a boil then lower to a simmer. Remove pistachios from shells and chop.
Add in the chopped pistachios and continue to simmer for 8–10 minutes. Stir occasionally to dissolve sugar.
Remove from heat. Let cool slightly before straining through a fine mesh sleeve. Stir in almond extract.
Store in a container in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
Slice butter into even pieces and place in a light-colored pan over medium to medium-low heat.
Stir gently as butter melts, foams and turns a golden-brown color.
Once foam and milk solids settle to the bottom, remove from heat. Store in a heatproof container.
Prepare espresso shot.
Add the Pisatchio Syrup and browned butter, stirring gently.
Froth milk and pour over the coffee. Learn more about enhancing your frothing skills by visiting our milk frothing guide.
Sprinkle with crushed shortbread cookies.

description: Rich caramel and sweet peach flavor in every sip. Create this refreshing and juicy recipe featuring Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Coffee, brewed to perfection with Nespresso® Vertuo.
name: Caramel Coffee Peach Spritzer​
recipeIngredient: 3 oz Caramel Coffee Vanilla Syrup (recipe below)​
Peach slices or turbinado sugar as garnish (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Place sugar in a 16-oz container and then brew 1 capsule of Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Coffee for Nespresso® Vertuo on top.
Let cool and add the vanilla extract. ​
Start by placing ice into a 16-oz glass.
Add in the Caramel Coffee Vanilla Syrup, followed by the peach nectar. ​
Fill glass to the top with chilled soda water and enjoy.

description: Enhance the cinnamon, butter and brown sugar notes of Starbucks® Cinnamon Dolce Flavored Coffee with this iced au lait inspired by the beloved Starbucks® Iced Cinnamon Dolce Latte at our cafés. ​
name: Iced Cinnamon Dolce Au Lait
recipeIngredient: 6 oz brewed Starbucks® Cinnamon Dolce Flavored Coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a small container and store.
Combine brewed coffee with whole milk and Cinnamon Dolce Syrup in a glass. Stir together.
Fill with ice.
Top with prepared whipped cream.
Sprinkle with Cinnamon Dolce Topping.

description: This new recipe for Nespresso® Original Line is a celebration of the iconic flavor of caramel. Refreshing and topped with a sweet caramel cold foam, it’s perfect for easy sipping on a peaceful day.
name: Iced Triple-Caramel Café Au Lait
recipeIngredient: 2  brewed espresso shots of Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Coffee by Nespresso®

recipeInstructions.text: Using a milk frother on its cold setting or a frothing wand, froth milk, caramel sauce and sea salt until smooth and creamy with fine bubbles. Set aside.
Pour caramel sauce into a 16-oz glass.
Brew 2 shots of Starbucks® Caramel Flavored Coffee by Nespresso® directly into the glass. Stir.
Fill glass with ice to 1 inch below the rim. Stir.
Top with Salted Caramel Cold Foam.

description: The delicious smoothness of Starbucks® Veranda Blend® coffee serves as the base for an incredibly refreshing spritzer. Bold, citrusy and nicely spiced—it’s the ideal mocktail for easy sipping.
name: Citrus Coffee Spritzer
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Veranda Blend® Cinnamon Citrus Syrup (recipe below)

recipeInstructions.text: Place cinnamon stick and sugar in a heat resistant container.
Brew 8 oz of Starbucks® Veranda Blend® coffee into the container and stir.
Place orange peel strips into the liquid.
Remove orange peel and cinnamon stick.
Place ice into a 16-oz glass.
Add Starbucks® Veranda Blend® Cinnamon Citrus Syrup.
Fill glass to top with chilled soda water.
Top with orange twist.

description: Inspired by the café favorite Starbucks® Frappuccino®, our Caramel Frozen Blended Coffee recipe is where coffee, milk and ice all come together for a delicious and icy drink.
name: Caramel Frozen Blended Coffee
recipeIngredient: 1 packet Starbucks VIA® Instant Italian Roast
2 Tbsp homemade Caramel Syrup (or storebought), plus more for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Blend your Starbucks VIA® Instant Italian Roast coffee in a blender along with your milk, caramel syrup, salt and ice. Mix on high until smooth.
Once blended, pour the mixture into your glass and top your drink off with a swirl of whipped cream and an additional drizzle of caramel sauce for the full café experience.

description: Introducing meal prep that's both easy and tasty. Our Overnight Grain Bowl is a hearty way to start your day and couldn't be easier to plan around. Simply whip oats, barley and fruit together, let sit overnight, and enjoy a delicious breakfast the next day with your favorite cup of Starbucks® coffee.
name: Overnight Grain Bowl

recipeInstructions.text: The night before you want to eat the grain bowl, combine 4 cups of the coconutmilk and remainder of ingredients in a large saucepan. While stirring, bring to boil.
Turn off heat and let sit covered for 30 minutes.
Add remaining coconutmilk and refrigerate overnight.
The next morning, stir the mixture. It should be thick and creamy.
If needed, add a small amount of coconutmilk to thin.
Place in bowl and top with fresh fruit and toppings such as puffed quinoa, chia seeds and local honey.
For best quality and safety, eat within 3 days of preparation.

description: Cold brew is the go-to cold coffee drink for many people, and it’s easy to see why. Equal parts delicious and refreshing, cold brew is the perfect drink to grab any time you need a cool pick-me-up. Enjoy this bubbly, citrusy twist on cold brew.
name: Sparkling Cold Brew
recipeIngredient: Starbucks® Signature Black Cold Brew Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Pour 4 oz Starbucks® Signature Black Cold Brew Concentrate over ice.
Top with sparkling water.
Add an orange or lemon twist!

description: Better days start with a sweeter sip. Welcome the sun with creamy oatmilk and a bright drizzle of honey.
name: Honey Oatmilk Café Au Lait

recipeInstructions.text: Combine honey and water in a small saucepan.
Bring to a boil and then lower heat to a simmer.
Simmer for 5–7 minutes while stirring occasionally.
Place 2 Tbsp of Honey Syrup in a mug.
Pour in Starbucks® Veranda Blend®.
Foam extra creamy oatmilk and pour into the mug. You can use a handheld milk frother or froth your milk by hand. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.

description: Rich chocolate and nutty flavors in every sip. Learn how to make this warming Hazelnut Mocha au Lait at home with Starbucks® Mocha Flavored Coffee.
name: Hazelnut Mocha au Lait
recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp chocolate syrup + 1 tsp for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Pour Hazelnut Syrup into a mug and add brewed Starbucks® Mocha Flavored Coffee. Stir.
Froth milk and pour over the coffee. Discover your preferred frothing method by visiting our milk frothing guide.
Top with whipped cream and drizzle with chocolate syrup.

description: Mix up your morning with delicious coffee and fresh fruit, all in the same bowl! Just follow these simple steps to create a bright Veranda Blend® Coffee Smoothie Bowl.
name: Coffee Smoothie Bowl Recipe
recipeIngredient: 1 cup brewed Starbucks® Veranda Blend® coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Brew Starbucks® Veranda Blend® coffee in your coffee brewer or coffee press and let it cool.
Put all the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. You want a consistency like a smooth ice cream.
Transfer to a bowl and top with your favorite add-ons like fruit, nuts, granola and coconut flakes!

description: Craft a cup full of vanilla flavor anytime with this delicious, café-inspired syrup recipe.
name: Vanilla Syrup

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the vanilla bean in half lengthwise.
Add the sugar, water and vanilla bean (if using) to a small saucepan. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to a simmer for 5 minutes.
Once cooled, strain out the vanilla bean from the syrup.
Enjoy in your favorite Starbucks® coffee or recipe.

description: Some people might tell you that sangria is a drink best enjoyed in the warm weather of the summer. Well, we think something this delicious shouldn’t be saved for just one season. Learn how to make a delicious sangria with Starbucks VIA® Instant and enjoy these fruity flavors whenever you feel that inner warm weather feeling calling. While this recipe is nonalcoholic, you can also add your favorite fruit-forward or full-bodied wine as a nice pairing to spice things up.
name: Sangria with Starbucks VIA® Instant
recipeIngredient: 0.0625 cup sugar, plus extra for garnish
0.25 orange, sliced into ¼-inch wheels, plus zest

recipeInstructions.text: Combine sugar, juices and fruit in a pitcher. Stir to dissolve sugar.
Let chill for several hours.
Dissolve Starbucks VIA® Colombia with a tablespoon of hot water in a large glass. Add a cup of the juice mixture and stir to fully combine.
Add back into sangria pitcher and stir to combine.
Right before serving, add soda water to sangria pitcher.
Take zest from orange and combine with equal amount of sugar. Dip moistened rims of tall glasses into the mixture.
Serve your sparkling creation and don’t forget to make sure everyone has a little bit of fruit in their glass, that’s the best part!

description: Starbucks® Classic Hot Cocoa is known for being perfectly sweet—and in this recipe, excitingly spicy too. Try this simple, quick recipe for a delicious and complex chocolate-flavored beverage.
name: Spiced Hot Cocoa
recipeIngredient: 1  Starbucks® Classic Hot Cocoa K-Cup® pod

recipeInstructions.text: Brew 1 Starbucks® Classic Hot Cocoa K-Cup® pod (8 oz).
Pour directly over Five Spice Blend in your favorite mug.
Stir until well mixed.
Top with whipped cream and an extra sprinkle of Five Spice Blend.

description: Delicious salmon and avocado lie on a bed of fluffy English muffin—and every bite is better than the last. Pair with your favorite coffee to make every morning a good morning.
name: Smoked Salmon Avocado Benedict

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the avocados across the short side through the center, creating a ring. Peel away the skin and reserve the rings for plating. Save the remaining trim for the sauce.
In a sauté pan, char the whole tomatillos in olive oil.
In a blender, combine the charred tomatillos, avocado scraps, cilantro, honey, lime juice, and salt and pepper. Purée until smooth and chill in the refrigerator until needed.
Bring water to a boil then set to a simmer. Add white vinegar.
Crack an egg into the simmering water and cook for approx. 4 minutes. The yolk should still be soft with the outside white set.
Remove from the water with a slotted spoon and dry well. Reserve in warm water until ready to assemble.
Toast the English muffin.
Lay 1 slice of smoked salmon on one side of the English muffin.
Place the avocado ring on top of the salmon.
Place the poached egg into the center of the avocado.
Spoon the tomatillo sauce over the poached egg. Repeat steps 5 through 11 for each of the remaining sandwiches.

description: Enjoy a sweet berry treat alongside your favorite Starbucks® coffee. Our comforting Fruit Crisp recipe pairs perfectly as a breakfast complement or an after-dinner dessert.
name: Fruit Crisp

recipeInstructions.text: Clean and cut strawberries.
Clean basil then remove leaves and tear by hand into small strips.
Mix all Berry Basil ingredients together.
Place in the baking pan.
Combine flour, sugars, cinnamon and salt.
Dice cold butter.
Add cold butter to the dry ingredients and mix at low speed until incorporated.
Add oats and mix until just combined.
Lightly grease a baking pan and fill ⅔ of the way with desired fruits.
Loosely top your favorite filling with the crisp batter and bake at 325°F until golden brown (about 30 minutes). Rotate halfway.

description: Enjoy a cold brew with sugar, spice and everything nice. This recipe takes the cold brew you already know and love from Starbucks® and infuses it with aromatic orange and a hint of cinnamon.
name: Spiced Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate​

recipeInstructions.text: Start by adding coffee, sugar, cinnamon sticks and orange peel to coffee press. Mix well.
Add water, then let sit for 18–24 hours in the refrigerator.
Press the coffee, pour it into a clean jar and seal.
When ready, pour equal parts concentrate and water into a glass.

description: Minty meets iced coffee for an incredibly refreshing experience. Simply combine a packet of Starbucks VIA® Instant with lemonade, cucumber and mint for a drink that’s packed with fresh-tasting flavor.
name: Starbucks® Iced Mint Coffee
recipeIngredient: 1 packet  Starbucks VIA® Instant Pike Place
0.5 cup  cucumber, peeled, seeded and grated

recipeInstructions.text: Dissolve half of your Starbucks VIA® Instant Pike Place packet with hot water in a pitcher.
Add lemonade, sugar, cucumber and mint to pitcher.
Let chill for several hours.
To serve, add ice to glasses and pour beverage over the top.

description: Treat your taste buds with this warm and white chocolaty drink. This muddled minty mocha is a rich and luscious way to satiate your sweet tooth and revel in a delightfully minty finish.
name: Muddled Mint White Chocolate Mocha

recipeInstructions.text: Brew Starbucks® Mocha Flavored Ground Coffee (or K-Cup® pods) double-strength.
Add white chocolate mocha sauce to your cup.
Add hot coffee to cup, pouring directly over white chocolate sauce.
Stir vigorously to dissolve. In a separate glass, muddle fresh mint and ice.
Pour coffee mixture on top of the fresh mint and ice. Top with whipped cream and a sprig of fresh mint.

description: Create a melt-in-your-mouth treat with a roasty crunch. All you need are espresso beans and melted chocolate to create a perfect accompaniment for any coffee beverage.
name: Chocolate Covered Coffee Beans​
recipeIngredient: 1 high-quality chocolate bar, broken into large pieces
0.333 cup espresso beans (we recommend Starbucks® Espresso Roast)

recipeInstructions.text: Line baking sheet or plate with parchment paper and set aside.
In double boiler, melt chocolate bar, stirring continuously. Once melted, remove from heat.
Pour in coffee beans. Mix well to ensure all beans are coated.
Using a fork, remove beans one at a time, letting excess chocolate drip off, and place on parchment paper.
Let beans sit for a few hours to dry.
Remove from baking sheet and place in airtight container. Store in the refrigerator and enjoy cold.

description: Brew a sweet cup of hot cocoa, add maraschino cherry juice and top with whipped cream for a delicious way to wind down the day.
name: Cherry Hot Cocoa​
recipeIngredient: Starbucks® Classic Hot Cocoa K-Cup® pod

recipeInstructions.text: Add 2 Tbsp cherry juice to your favorite mug.
Brew 1 Starbucks® Classic Hot Cocoa K-Cup® pod (8 fl oz) directly into mug and stir.
Top with whipped cream and cherry.

description: Refresh your day with Sparkling Espresso with Mint. This bubbly, effervescent drink is deliciously minty and features the delicious Starbucks® espresso taste you love.
name: Sparkling Espresso with Mint​

recipeInstructions.text: Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add simple syrup, fresh mint and Starbucks Brand espresso.
Shake vigorously for 10 seconds.
Strain into a glass filled with ice.
Top with sparkling water.

description: Introducing the recipe where each word (and bite) is more delicious than the last. Enjoy this warm, comforting, fruity baked good with a hot cup of Breakfast Blend. It’s perfect for breakfast, dessert or any time of the day.
name: French Toast Bread Pudding with Peach Compote​

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F.
Combine whole milk, heavy cream, eggs, sugar, vanilla extract and salt in a bowl to make the custard. Whisk until evenly combined.
Slice a variety of bread (multigrain, sourdough, white bread, brioche, etc.) into 1-inch cubes.
Combine all bread in a greased 9”x13” baking dish. Pour custard liquid evenly and gently press bread down to ensure all pieces are saturated.
Cover baking dish with foil, place in a roasting pan and put into oven.
Once in the oven add 1-inch of warm water to the roasting pan. This will help the custard cook more evenly.
Cover French Toast Bread Pudding with foil and bake for 35 minutes.
Blanch peaches, by first boiling a large pot of water. Have a large bowl of ice water prepared as well. Make a thin cut around the circumference of the peaches.

When water is boiling, carefully drop or lower peaches into the water, then set a timer for 2 minutes. Using a slotted spoon or ladle retrieve peaches from pot and place in ice water; the skins should come off very easily. Dice the peaches.

For peach compote, combine peaches, maple syrup, brown sugar, lemon juice, lime zest and vanilla extract in a sauce pan, heat to just below a simmer and let stew for 15–20 minutes until peaches are soft. Do not allow the compote to boil.
Remove foil and cook for an additional 10 to 15 minutes until top is golden brown and custard is set. Remove from oven and allow to cool slightly before slicing and serving.

description: Enjoy a Coffee Peanut Butter Protein Smoothie with Starbucks® Pike Place® Roast to give you the flavor you need for your busy day. Packed with banana, peanut butter, chia seeds and honey, this rich coffee smoothie recipe is a perfectly delicious way to start the day.
name: Coffee Peanut Butter Smoothie
recipeIngredient: 6 oz Starbucks® Pike Place® Roast coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Add Starbucks® Pike Place® Roast coffee, banana, chocolate almondmilk, chia seeds, honey and peanut butter to the blender.
Blend until smooth.
Add ice cubes to make smoothie thicker if you prefer. Blend again.

description: Grab your favorite childhood cereal and brew something equal parts delicious and nostalgic with our Cereal Milk Coffee. This recipe uses Veranda Blend® for a warm and sweet drink that tastes as timeless as cartoons and cereal.
name: Cereal Milk Coffee​

recipeInstructions.text: Combine cinnamon cereal and whole milk. Heat using preferred method. Steep for 4 minutes, then spoon cereal out of milk. You can also steep the cereal longer to increase the cereal flavoring.
Froth remaining cereal milk and sugar using your preferred method. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.
Pour brewed Veranda Blend® coffee into a mug.
Add frothed cereal milk.
Top with whipped cream and remaining 1 Tbsp of crushed cereal.

description: Starbucks® Holiday Blend, cherry cream and just a hint of almond? Sounds like the perfect way to top off the holidays. From that first sip, this delightful holiday recipe will become the sensation of your season.
name: Starbucks® Holiday Blend Café Au Lait with​ Cherry Almond Sweet Cream

recipeInstructions.text: Combine heavy whipping cream, cherry juice and almond extract in a bowl. Whisk or blend with a mixer until very soft peaks form. Set the sweet cream aside.​
Pour coffee into a mug and sweeten as needed to your liking.​
Froth the milk, then pour into a mug.​​
Top with desired amount of cherry almond sweet cream and enjoy.​

description: Pumpkin spice on ice. With this Pumpkin Spice Cold Foam recipe, your fall days just got tastier.
name: Pumpkin Spice Cold Foam
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Cold Brew Pumpkin Spice Flavored Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Place water, sugars, pumpkin purée, vanilla extract and pumpkin pie spice into a sauté pan. ​
Simmer for 4 minutes until the sugars are melted.
Strain through fine mesh strainer into a container.
Store and keep refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.
After making the Sweet Pumpkin Spice Syrup, pour Starbucks® Cold Brew Pumpkin Spice Flavored Concentrate into a glass over ice, add water and stir.
Put the milk and Sweet Pumpkin Spice Syrup in an aeretor and froth using the cold foam setting. If using a handheld frother, pour ingredients into a separate container and froth until fluffy.
Gently pour on top of your iced coffee. Enjoy.

description: Coffee, banana and frozen yogurt: an irresistible breakfast trifecta. Here’s how to combine them in a smoothie that is sure to become a delicious new part of your morning routine.
name: Coffee Smoothie
recipeIngredient: 1 packet Starbucks VIA® Instant French Roast

recipeInstructions.text: Add frozen yogurt, milk, Starbucks VIA® Instant Coffee, banana and ice to a blender.
Blend the ingredients until the mixture is smooth.

description: It’s a classic for a reason. Bring out your inner barista with a café staple where dark, rich espresso sits beneath a frothy layer of foam for a simple yet delicious drink.
name: Classic Cappuccino

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare espresso shot and pour into mug once brewed.
In a separate container, froth milk.
Gently pour your frothed milk into your mug until it’s almost full.
Add any remaining foam to the top of your beverage and enjoy!

description: Cold brew … coconut … milkshake … need we say more? This delicious, refreshing and tasty beverage is a frosty way to indulge, cool down and perk up all at the same time! Recipe and image sourced from Tastemade & Starbucks recipe book partnership.
name: Cold Brew Coconut Chocolate Milkshake
recipeIngredient: 4 oz  Starbucks® Cold Brew Multi-Serve Concentrate

recipeInstructions.text: Combine your Starbucks® Cold Brew Concentrate, coconut ice cream and semisweet chocolate chips in blender, then blend until smooth.
Pour into a glass and top with whipped cream and toasted coconut.

description: Add a splash of this mint-infused simple syrup to your favorite coffee for a refreshing twist.
name: Mint-Infused Simple Syrup​
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup  fresh mint leaves to taste (about a handful)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine water, sugar, mint and vanilla in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Stir continuously until sugar dissolves and the syrup comes to a boil.
Continue stirring for another 2 minutes, then remove from heat. You can either strain out the leaves or leave them to continue infusing the syrup.
Let cool completely (refrigerate), then pour about 2 Tbsp per 1 cup of (double-brewed) iced coffee (to taste).
Garnish with an extra sprig!

description: Enjoy the best of both worlds with this unforgettable beverage, where espresso swirls together with the classic combination of chocolate flavor and orange zest.
name: Orange Mocha​

recipeInstructions.text: Over medium heat, add milk to your saucepan and bring to a simmer.
Add in mocha sauce, brown sugar and orange zest; whisk briskly to create a layer of foam.
Pour milk mixture into espresso; separating and discarding the orange zest.
Prepare espresso and pour into the center of your mug.
Top with whipped cream and fresh orange zest.
Prepare espresso and pour into mug.

description: A little whiskey goes a long way in this coffee cocktail. Nothing melts away the chills like piping hot coffee and a shot of Irish whiskey—preferably mixed together with a bit of brown sugar and topped with a heaping scoop of whipped cream. Here’s how to whip up this cold-weather favorite for a few lucky friends.
name: Irish Coffee
recipeIngredient: (for homemade whipped cream, 1 cup heavy whipping cream + 1 Tbsp sugar)

recipeInstructions.text: Stir brown sugar, whiskey and coffee together in a tall glass.
Top with a scoop (or two) of whipped cream.
Finish it off with a sprinkle of nutmeg.

description: Longer days, warmer nights and a taste for all things iced. This easy-to-make recipe for Starbucks® Iced Coffee Cocktails combines our two favorite things: Breakfast Blend and a splash of flavored spirits.
name: Iced Coffee Cocktails

recipeInstructions.text: Brew your coffee in a pour-over or coffee press.
Mix together coffee and vodka, stirring as you pour.
Add the remaining ingredients to taste, then pour over ice.

description: The secret to keeping iced coffee strong When it comes to warmer weather, nothing hits the spot quite like a delicious iced coffee. Here’s a simple tip to get the most out of your brew—make your ice cubes out of coffee. When you pour hot coffee over regular ice cubes, they water it down and dilute the taste as they melt. But with coffee cubes, you get full flavor down to the last drop.
name: Coffee Ice Cubes
recipeIngredient: 16 oz  coffee, brewed regular strength (Recommend Starbucks® Espresso Roast)

recipeInstructions.text: Brew coffee in a coffee press and let cool.
Once close to room temperature, pour your coffee evenly into an ice cube tray and place in freezer.
Once the coffee in your ice cube tray is completely frozen, fill your glass with the frozen coffee cubes.
Top your glass off with hot coffee.
Add cream and sweetener if desired.

description: This creative take on the classic cocktail is easy to make and sure to delight. In place of the bourbon traditionally used to make an Old Fashioned, we’re substituting delicious homemade cold brew coffee.
name: Cold Brew Old Fashioned

recipeInstructions.text: Drape cheesecloth inside the mason jar.
Add coffee. We recommend Starbucks® Breakfast Blend with a coarse grind. Fill with pure, filtered water. Steep for 12 hours at room temperature.
Strain and discard cheesecloth with coffee grounds.
Make orange syrup. Add water, raw sugar and orange peels to saucepan.
Make orange syrup. Add water, raw sugar and orange peels to saucepan.
Add orange syrup and Angostura® bitters to glass and stir.
Add ice then top with the Breakfast Blend cold brew that you steeped overnight.
Rim glass with orange peel.
Garnish with an orange twist and a cherry or two.

description: With maple, vanilla and brown sugar, this recipe puts everything sweet into one delicious cup of coffee. Top it with whipped cream and cinnamon for an extra layer of yum.​
name: Maple Vanilla and Brown Sugar Coffee
recipeIngredient: 8 oz Starbucks® Maple Pecan Flavored Coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Brew Starbucks® Maple Pecan Flavored Coffee.
Stir half-and-half, brown sugar, and vanilla  extract into brewed hot coffee.
Top with whipped cream and cinnamon (optional).

description: Elevate the classic Americano with orange syrup, frothy milk and a sprinkling of demerara sugar.
name: Americano Con Crema

recipeInstructions.text: Make the orange syrup first. In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, add water, sugar and orange peel. Stir occasionally for 5 minutes or until sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool. Strain into a container.
Next, make the Americano con Crema. Froth the milk in a blender on high for 2 minutes, then let it sit for 1–2 minutes.
Prepare 2 shots of espresso and pour into a mug.
Add the orange syrup, espresso and ¼ cup of hot water to a mug and stir.
Top the beverage with a few spoonfuls of milk froth and sprinkle with sugar if desired.

description: Starbucks VIA® Instant coffee meets butterscotch in this sweet recipe that’s sure to be a new morning favorite.
name: Starbucks VIA® Butterscotch
recipeIngredient: 1 packet  Starbucks VIA® Instant Medium Roast Colombia coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Pour your Starbucks VIA® Instant coffee, butterscotch and sugar into a mug.
Heat your milk by pouring it into a microwave-safe container and heating it on medium-high power, stirring every 15 seconds until steam begins to rise from the milk.
Stir together your coffee mixture and heated milk until the butterscotch chips are fully melted.

description: A glitzy holiday deserves a classy cocktail. Ring in the new year in style with this smoky-sweet French Roast cocktail with a hint of bright citrus.
name: NYE Iced Coffee Cocktail

recipeInstructions.text: Brew 4 oz of Starbucks® French Roast coffee using your preferred brewing method.
Chill the coffee in the fridge.
In a shaker, combine the bourbon whiskey, crème de cacao, simple syrup, orange bitters and coffee.
Add ice into the shaker and shake 10 times to chill the beverage.
Strain the beverage into a glass over fresh ice.

description: Long summer days mean more time for warm and toasty marshmallow-topped coffee.
name: Toasted Marshmallow Café Au Lait
recipeIngredient: 1  Starbucks® Toasted Graham Flavored Coffee K-Cup® pod

recipeInstructions.text: Brew one K-Cup® pod of Starbucks® Toasted Graham Flavored Coffee.
Stir chocolate into hot coffee.​
In a separate container, froth 2% milk using your preferred method. You can use a handheld milk frother or froth your milk by hand. Read our frothing guide here.
Pour frothed milk into your mug.​
Top with 2 marshmallows and sprinkle of graham cracker crumbs. For s’more summer flavor, toast your marshmallows over a bonfire.

description: A popular tradition in Mexico and Spain, this beverage often features rice, milk and cinnamon. Learn how to make a quick, delicious version with Starbucks VIA® Instant Coffee.
name: Instant Coffee Horchata
recipeIngredient: 0.5 packets Starbucks VIA® Instant Italian Roast

recipeInstructions.text: Soak rice in the water overnight, or for at least 1 hour.
Add the rice and its soaking water to a blender, along with the vanilla, cinnamon, sugar and Starbucks VIA® Instant Coffee. Blend for 2 minutes.
Strain the blended mixture into a storage container and stir in the milk.
Cover the container and chill the mixture completely (overnight is optimal).
When you’re ready to serve the horchata, pour it into a serving pitcher, leaving any sediment behind.

description: A simply delicious way to flavor your brew. Dropping a couple sticks of cinnamon into your coffee press adds the perfect amount of spice to your favorite brew. Here’s how to get the cinnamon-to-coffee ratio just right.
name: Cinnamon Coffee
recipeIngredient: 6 oz hot water, just off the boil

recipeInstructions.text: Add coffee grounds and broken cinnamon sticks to the coffee press.
Pour in the hot water, saturating the coffee and cinnamon.
Place the plunger on top of the press, but don’t push down.
Let brew for 4 minutes, then push the plunger all the way down.

description: It’s Dalgona with a twist. Try our cold brew take on the viral coffee sensation, and learn how to make it upside down for a drink that’s as delicious as it is eye-catching.
name: Upside Down Cold Brew Dalgona Coffee
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Multi-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate Signature Black

recipeInstructions.text: Pour 4 oz of Starbucks® Multi-Serve Cold Brew Concentrate into a glass over ice, combine with 4 oz of water and stir.
In a mixing bowl, combine your heavy cream, sugar and vanilla and whisk vigorously until the mixture turns light and fluffy like whipped cream.
Layer your whipped topping over the top of the coffee.
Make your drink a little more summery with unique toppings like coconut shavings, fruit or cinnamon.

description: Learn how to make your own café au lait at home. Pronounced café o-lay, French for “coffee with milk,” this recipe is a perfect blend of sweet chocolate and caramel, all balanced with a light hint of salt.
name: Salted Caramel Café Au Lait
recipeIngredient: 3 tsp dark chocolate sauce or syrup
homemade Caramel Sauce (or storebought) for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Start with adding dark chocolate sauce and toffee nut syrup to your cup.
Add a pinch of sea salt.
Pour in hot coffee and stir to dissolve.
Add milk; cold is great, but hot is better.
Top it off with whipped cream, caramel sauce and a sprinkle of sea salt.

description: Our Iced Irish Coffee recipe turns the iconic combination of coffee, Irish cream liqueur and whiskey into a delicious iced beverage.
name: Iced Irish Coffee​
recipeIngredient: 7 Tbsp  Starbucks® Pike Place® Roast coffee (brewed at double strength)

recipeInstructions.text: Pour double-strength coffee, whiskey and Irish cream liqueur over ice and stir.
Add mint sprig for garnish.

description: Next time you’re brewing coffee, put a little to the side to make this simple, flavorful drizzle—perfect for topping off all your favorite baked goods.
name: Coffee Drizzle Glaze​

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk together powdered sugar and coffee in a small bowl until it’s smooth and has reached the desired thickness.
Drizzle over your favorite croissants and pastries.

description: Make a batch of Cinnamon Dolce Syrup ahead and treat guests (or yourself) to a deliciously refreshing moment anytime.
name: Cinnamon Dolce Syrup

recipeInstructions.text: Combine all ingredients in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to a low simmer for 10 minutes.
Allow syrup to cool.
Remove cinnamon sticks.
Store and refrigerate for up to 2 weeks.

description: Rich, creamy and dairy-free. Delicious coconut, Starbucks® Sumatra coffee and a hint of cocoa make this smoothie an irresistible treat.
name: Blended Coconut Coffee
recipeIngredient: 0.5 cup  light coconutmilk, canned (shake well before opening)
0.5 cup  strong brewed coffee (try Starbucks® Sumatra)

recipeInstructions.text: Add ice, brown sugar, cocoa powder, coconutmilk and coffee to blender.
Blend until smooth.
Pour into a glass and serve.

description: Refreshing, decadent and ready in a matter of minutes. It's easier than ever to make a classic iced mocha at home with Starbucks® Premium Instant Coffee.
name: Iced Mocha
recipeIngredient: 4 oz whole milk or any non-dairy alternative
Whipped cream and chocolate syrup or shavings (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine Starbucks® Premium Instant Coffee and cool water in a glass.
Fill with ice.
Combine whole milk and chocolate syrup in a separate glass. Stir together then combine with the first glass.
