Top with whipped cream and chocolate syrup or shavings to taste, and enjoy.

description: Learn how to make a delicious Vietnamese Iced Coffee with Starbucks® coffee. Take your taste buds on a trip with this refreshing recipe featuring iced coffee and swirling condensed milk. Recipe and image sourced from Tastemade & Starbucks recipe book partnership.
name: Vietnamese Iced Coffee
recipeIngredient: 4 oz brewed Starbucks® Caffè Verona® Ground Coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Brew your Starbucks® Caffè Verona® ground coffee. For optimal taste, we recommend using the pour-over method.
Pour your brewed coffee over ice and leave some room at the top.
Pour your sweetened condensed milk into the top of the glass.
Stir and top your drink off with a mint sprig.

description: Directly translating to “White Hazelnut,”  our Hazelnut Bianco recipe is a wonderfully light-colored espresso drink with accents of white chocolate and hazelnut flavors.
name: Hazelnut Bianco
recipeIngredient: 1 cup  whole milk (or milk of your choice)

recipeInstructions.text: Using a Nespresso® Aeroccino frother, froth milk on medium setting.
Add milk, shaved white chocolate and prepared espresso shot to mug.
Serve with a spoonful of hazelnut spread, gently stirring to dissolve.

description: With sweet vanilla, rich coffee and luscious cream cheese, our Vanilla Coffee Cheesecake recipe is a perfect balance of complementary flavors. Enjoy alongside a cup of your favorite Starbucks® coffee for a perfectly delicious dessert.
name: Vanilla Coffee Cheesecake​

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F. Wrap the bottom and sides of the springform pan with foil to prevent water seepage when baking.
Mix all crust ingredients together.
Line 10-inch springform pan with crust mixture on the bottom, reserving about ¼ for along the sides. Pack firmly by pressing with hand.
Bake to dry out for 15 minutes.
Mix cream cheese, sugar and sour cream until smooth. Do not over mix.
Add 1 egg at a time, and be careful not to aerate.
Divide the batter in 2.
Flavor ⅔ of the batter with vanilla extract, and the other ⅓ with the coffee packets.
Pour the vanilla batter into a springform pan with graham cracker crust.
Pour the coffee batter in a circle along the outer edge of the pan.
Using a skewer or small knife, gently swirl the batter to form a marble pattern. Do not over swirl. Less is more.
Place cheesecake pan into a larger baking pan and fill halfway with warm water.
Bake cheesecake in the water bath until the center is firm to the touch.
Remove cheesecake pan from the water bath carefully and allow to cool.
Remove springform and chill until needed.

description: Take your favorite mug on a trip with our Cuban coffee recipe. Cuban coffee is all about technique. While getting the sugar just right takes a little bit of skill, it’s more than worth it for this delicious take on espresso. The way you know you’ve made a great Cuban coffee is by your espumita (little foam), which is the layer of foam on top of each cup of espresso.
name: Café Cubano​ Recipe

recipeInstructions.text: Fill your moka pot with water until just up to the steam release valve.
Fill your moka pot funnel filter to the top with ground espresso, lightly press and level out.
Put the top chamber on the moka pot, ensure it's twisted on tight, and put the pot on a stovetop burner at medium-high heat.
While the coffee is heating, put 4 heaping tsp of sugar into a 12-oz metal creamer.
Wait for the first bit of coffee to percolate out, then take a tsp of coffee and pour it into your sugar.
Using the back of the same teaspoon, grind the coffee and sugar against the wall of the metal creamer for 60 seconds until consistent and paste-like.
Once all coffee is brewed, remove your moka pot from the burner. Pour the remainder of your coffee very slowly into the sugar paste.
Serve into espresso cups, ensuring a fine layer of foam.

description: A delicious way to spice up your coffee sweetener. This sweet, spicy syrup is perfect for flavoring iced coffee, cold brew or any of your favorite Starbucks® drinks. Keep it on hand to add a delicious splash of honey ginger to your morning cup any time.
name: Honey Ginger Simple Syrup
recipeIngredient: 1 inch piece  fresh ginger, peeled and cut into pieces

recipeInstructions.text: In a small saucepan, combine honey, water and ginger and simmer for 35–45 minutes.
Strain syrup into a jar. Discard ginger pieces, then let syrup cool before sealing the jar.
Fill a glass with ice and 1–2 Tbsp of syrup.
Prepare double-strength coffee in your preferred method. For optimal taste, we recommend using the coffee press method.
Top off with creamer (optional).

description: Treat your cup to a Caramel Coffee Bomb. Drop this DIY creation into a mug of your favorite Starbucks® coffee and watch the flavors bloom!
name: Caramel Coffee Bomb​
recipeIngredient: 2 oz dark chocolate, chopped (65% cacao or higher dark chocolate recommended​)

recipeInstructions.text: Place 14 oz of chocolate in a glass bowl and microwave for 30 seconds, leaving the remaining 2 oz of chocolate to drizzle later.
Stir chocolate from outside edges of bowl to the center.
Microwave chocolate for 15 more seconds and stir again.
Take temperature and be sure not to exceed 90°F.
Repeat steps 2–4 until chocolate pieces are mostly melted.
Keep stirring, using the residual heat of the bowl to finish.
Using a pastry brush, spread a layer of chocolate inside each mold.
Chill for a few minutes, then add a second layer of chocolate to mold, being sure to build up the rim.
Chill for 10 minutes.
Carefully push chocolate half-spheres out of the molds.

Fill 8 of the half-spheres with 1 oz of caramel each.​ For different flavors, try adding chocolate chips, caramel candy pieces, or butterscotch chips on the interior of the bombs. For a creamier coffee bomb, try adding a splash of your favorite liquid creamer; just be sure to enjoy immediately.
Warm a skillet on lowest heat.
One at a time, hold the rim of an empty half sphere to the warmed pan until lightly melted.
Immediately press the tops of one of the caramel-filled half spheres and let set.
Repeat until all bombs are whole.
Melt remaining 2 oz of chocolate and drizzle over bombs.
Immediately sprinkle crushed caramel candy onto the top of each bomb. Store in a cool, dry place for up to 1 week.

description: The path to delicious iced coffee is paved with Milk and Honey Ice Cubes. Enjoy the creamy sweetness of these easy-to-make additions all year long.
name: Milk & Honey Ice Cubes

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk honey and milk together.
Pour into ice trays and freeze.
Add to your coffee!

description: Looking for a delicious way to cool off on a warm day? Try this fresh take on a traditional ice cream float. Easy to make at home, this cold brew coffee drink is ready to delight anyone who loves the combination of sweet and salty.
name: Smoked Sea Salt Coffee Float

recipeInstructions.text: Cover a large mason jar with cheesecloth.
Add coffee.
Fill with the gallon of pure, filtered water.
Steep for 12 hours at room temperature.
Make the Smoked Sea Salt and Vanilla Syrup by combining 1 cup water, raw sugar, vanilla and smoked sea salt in saucepan (detailed steps below).
Bring to a boil to dissolve sugar, then let cool.
Strain cold brew and discard cheesecloth with grounds.
For the coffee float, mix Smoked Sea Salt Syrup and cold brew in glass.
Add vanilla gelato or ice cream.
Top with a splash of sparkling water.
Garnish with smoked sea salt.
Split the vanilla bean* lengthwise, scrape the seeds using the edge of a knife, then add both the bean and seeds to a saucepan.
Add in all other ingredients over medium heat and cook until sugar dissolves and mixture comes to a boil.
Remove from heat and cool completely.
Pour into a glass jar and store at room temperature.

description: Cold, sweet ice cream meets hot, roasty espresso. The affogato is easy to make and a treat for the senses. Learn how to make this quintessential Italian dessert, topped off with a pinch of chocolate and a sprinkling of sea salt.
name: Affogato
recipeIngredient: 0.25 cup hot espresso or brewed coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Add ice cream to a bowl or cup. Pour espresso or coffee over ice cream.
Drizzle with Grand Marnier® or Cointreau® (optional).
Top with chocolate shavings.
Sprinkle sea salt on top and serve immediately.

description: Start the day with a rich and refreshing iced coffee that bears hints of cinnamon and honey with each sip.
name: Iced Cinnamon Honey Coffee

recipeInstructions.text: In a small saucepan, bring your water, honey and cinnamon sticks to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and let simmer for 10 minutes.
Remove from heat, stir in vanilla and let cool completely.
Store your syrup in a container in the fridge.
Add ice cubes to a glass.
Prepare double-strength coffee in your preferred method. For optimal taste, we recommend using the coffee press method.
Pour in coffee, milk and your cinnamon honey syrup, then stir to combine.
Adjust to your taste with milk and syrup.

description: Grab your favorite Starbucks® roast and get cracking! Iced coffee spheres allow you to enjoy an iced beverage that's as delicious as it is fun to make.
name: Iced Coffee Sphere​
recipeIngredient: 2 Tbsp  Brown Sugar Cinnamon Simple Syrup

recipeInstructions.text: Combine brown sugar, white sugar and water in a small saucepan and bring to a boil.​
Reduce heat once sugar is melted.​
Add cinnamon sticks and simmer for 5 minutes.​
Let cool. Syrup can be stored refrigerated for up to 2 weeks. ​
Fill ice sphere mold to fill line with water.
Freeze for 2–3 hours (aiming for ¼-inch thick ice layer).
Remove sphere from mold. Empty spheres can be stored in the freezer for up to 2 weeks.
Warm a metal straw with hot water and puncture the iced sphere.
Using the straw, fill empty ice sphere with cold brew.​
Place half and half in bottom of glass.​
Place filled ice sphere into glass.​
Drizzle with Brown Sugar Cinnamon Simple Syrup.​
Sprinkle lightly with turbinado sugar.
Crack open ice sphere.

description: Learn how to make a delicious honey latte … then caramelize it! Superbly sweet and delightfully creamy, this is the perfect drink to brighten any winter day. Crafted around Caffè Verona®, our Caramelized Honey Latte recipe is dripping in caramel and honey flavors dancing over a bed of roasty sweet coffee with notes of dark cocoa.
name: Caramelized Honey Latte
recipeIngredient: 2 oz brewed Starbucks® Ca­ffè Verona® Whole Bean Coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Place the honey, water and lemon juice in a small pan and bring to a steady simmer on medium heat while stirring.
Once the honey mixture begins to bubble, stop stirring and let the honey sit for 1–2 minutes until it deepens in color and releases a nutty aroma. That’s how you know it is caramelized.
Slowly pour and whisk in the milk until combined. Remove from heat.
Prepare espresso.
Combine the caramelized honey milk and espresso into your favorite cup.
Froth milk using your preferred method, and top with a drizzle of honey!

description: Grab a cocktail shaker and shake it up! This classic Italian iced espresso recipe is a delicious, sweet, creamy drink that’s topped off with a fluffly layer of foam.
name: Shakerato
recipeIngredient: 4 oz brewed Starbucks® Pike Place® Roast ground coffee, chilled (we recommend using the traditional drip method)

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium saucepan, add sweetened condensed milk and half and half (or whole milk). Over low heat, stir frequently for 5–10 minutes.
Cool completely and keep refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 5 days.
Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add chilled co­ffee and simple syrup.
Shake vigorously for 20–30 seconds until coffee becomes foamy. Strain into a glass. Top with coffee foam from shaker.
Add sweet cream syrup to taste.

description: Macchiato is an espresso drink with a small amount of milk, which is usually frothed. In this recipe, complementary flavors of maple syrup and cinnamon dance together over a delicious espresso base.
name: Maple Cinnamon Macchiato​

recipeInstructions.text: Combine maple syrup and oatmilk and froth in Nespresso® Aeroccino frother on high setting.
Brew lungo shot and add frothed milk, top with flavored foam.
Sprinkle with cinnamon.

description: Rise with the sun and break out the coconutmilk to make the most of the day with this delectably sweet and creamy morning coffee.
name: Honey Coconut Café Au Lait
recipeIngredient: 3 Tbsp whole milk or your milk of choice

recipeInstructions.text: Pour your milk, coconutmilk and honey into a milk frother and proceed to froth to your liking.
Brew your Starbucks® Veranda Blend® coffee in a coffee brewer or coffee press.
Pour your brewed coffee into your favorite mug and slowly pour your frothed milk into the coffee to taste. We recommend 3 parts coffee to 1 part frothed milk.
Top your mug with any extra foam from the flavored steamed milk and a drizzle of honey to taste. Garnish with a sprinkle of toasted coconut.

description: Starbucks® Colombia medium roast coffee mixed with cookies and cream ice cream? Yes, please! This spin on a classic Italian dessert is easy to make and impossible to forget.
name: Affogato Dessert​
recipeIngredient: 1 scoop  cookies and cream ice cream

recipeInstructions.text: Brew and pour espresso shot over scoop of ice cream.
Top with candy, nuts or whipped cream (optional).

description: Delicious sourdough bread topped with cremini mushrooms and poached eggs—and every bite is better than the last. Pair with your favorite coffee to make every morning a good morning.
name: Mushroom Toast with Poached Eggs

recipeInstructions.text: Slice all the mushrooms about ⅛" thick.
In a large sauté pan, heat olive oil.
Add mushrooms and sauté over medium heat until all the moisture evaporates.
Add the sprigs of thyme and salt and pepper to taste. Reserve warm.
Toast the sourdough and reserve warm.
Bring water to a boil then set to a simmer. Add white vinegar.
Crack an egg into the simmering water and cook for approx. 4 minutes. The yolk should still be soft with the outside white set.
Remove from the water with a slotted spoon and dry well. Reserve in warm water until ready to assemble.
Place sautéed mushrooms on top of the grilled toast. Try to create a well for the eggs to sit.
Place the poached eggs on top of the mushrooms.

description: Enjoy our savory Potato Bacon Frittata recipe with a cup of your favorite Starbucks® coffee.
name: Potato Bacon Frittata​

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Peel the potato and cut into a 1⁄2" dice.
Toss in olive oil, salt, pepper and rosemary.
Bake for 30 minutes or until the center is soft and outside crispy.
Slice onion into thin strips and caramelize over low heat.
Bake the strips of bacon until crispy. Chop once cooled.
Combine the eggs and cream and whisk until homogeneous.
In a 6" nonstick, oven-safe sauté pan, combine all the toppings and sauté in olive oil.
Add the egg mixture and cook on the stovetop until the outside edges solidify. Place in the oven and bake until the center is firm.
Remove from the oven and invert onto a plate.

description: Your perfect fall nightcap. Create your own delicious salty caramel martini, featuring Starbucks® Salted Caramel Mocha Flavored Coffee.
name: Salted Caramel Coffee Martini
recipeIngredient: 4 oz Starbucks® Salted Caramel Mocha Flavored Coffee, brewed and cooled
Extra caramel sauce and sea salt flakes to rim glass

recipeInstructions.text: Place ice in a martini shaker​. Add the cooled Starbucks® Salted Caramel Mocha Flavored Coffee, coffee liqueur, vodka, caramel sauce, half-and-half, and a pinch of sea salt into the shaker.​
Place lid on and shake for 20 seconds. ​
Rim 2 martini glasses with caramel sauce and a sprinkle of sea salt flakes.
Divide mixture from the shaker into the glasses. Enjoy.​

description: Nothing goes better with a delicious cup of hot cocoa than fluffy, homemade marshmallows. Learn how to whip up your own at home.
name: Homemade Marshmallows​

recipeInstructions.text: Soak 4 envelopes of gelatin in 1 cup of cold water. Set aside.
In a saucepan, combine 4 cups sugar with 1 cup of chilled water. Stir over medium heat until sugar crystals dissolve, and add gelatin from packets. Bring to a boil and stir.
Once it's boiling, remove from heat, pour into a bowl and let cool.
Add ½ tsp salt and 3 tsp vanilla extract. Mix with a mixer until doubled in thickness.
Pour into a greased glass baking pan and let set.
Cut into shapes using cookie cutters and dust with powdered sugar.
